instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime fan spinning
threads.message:
Got minor liquid, after ultrasonic I got power, green light then orange light on magsafe when battery is connected but no chime and no backlight, fan spinning constantly not loud very quite.
When magsafe disconnected it goes down even though I get orange indication. Also, it won't go into SMC mode (long press on power and connecting magsafe)
No schematic or .brd for this model yet, any guidance will be appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime fan spinning
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime fan spinning
threads.message: Nope, no usb mouse light..what it should indicate? rip smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime fan spinning
threads.message: It indicates it could be anything.....Is there CPU Vcore? Can it be cleaned up good enough to send to Apple. Replace the water indicators of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime fan spinning
threads.message: Hmmm need to check if it still under warranty..like that thought.
